title: R-Guide
text:
Welcome fellow peoples
This site is a curated collection of resources for working efficiently with R ‚Äî from beginner-friendly guides to reusable templates and workflows.
üìö What you‚Äôll find here:

Practical tutorials on using R and the tidyverse
Clean, ready-to-use Quarto and RMarkdown templates
Tips on reproducibility, renv, and project structure
Example projects and GitHub-ready setups


Want to know more? Read about this project
Presentations

FMII-Data analysis

title: About
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm David ‚Äî welcome to my project!
This site is a personal initiative to collect, create, and share helpful resources for working with R. Whether you‚Äôre just starting out or you‚Äôre looking for clean, ready-to-use guides, templates, and best practices, you‚Äôll find a growing collection here.
I‚Äôm passionate about making data science workflows more efficient and reproducible. With tools like Quarto, RMarkdown, and GitHub, we can build powerful and transparent data projects ‚Äî and this site is my way of helping others do the same.
All content on this site is open-source, so feel free to explore, use, and adapt anything you find useful.

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Hello, There
This presentation will show you examples of what you can do with Quarto and Reveal.js, including:

Presenting code and LaTeX equations
Including computations in slide output
Image, video, and iframe backgrounds
Fancy transitions and animations
Activating scroll view

‚Ä¶and much more

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Goal of this session

Learn how to prepare and analyze psychological data
Tools: SPSS, Jamovi, R-Studio
Understand key steps: cleaning ‚Üí analyzing ‚Üí reporting

üß∞ Hands-on and practical!

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Why Prepare Your Data?


‚ÄúGarbage in, garbage out.‚Äù ‚Äì Good data = good results.




Identify missing or incorrect data
Ensure correct variable types (nominal, ordinal, scale)
Reproduzierbarkeit
mehr √úbersicht
einfachere Auswertung




90% of the time is data preperation, 10% is data analysis


Learn more: Syntax Highlighting

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Tools for Analysis
   










Tool
Strengths
Common Use Cases




SPSS
Robust, GUI-based, legacy support
Academic research, clinical trials, surveys


Jamovi
Easy UI, fast output, Open Source
Exploratory analyses, student projects


JASP
APA-style output, Open Source
Psychological research, Bayesian inference


R
Fully flexible, scriptable, Open Source
Reproducible science, data pipelines, automation




 and many, many more: Python, Julia, etc.

find Setup guides here

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Step 1: Data Preparation (SPSS)

Import your dataset (e.g., CSV, Excel)
Label your variables (Variable View)
Set correct measurement levels
Recode or compute variables as needed

 üìå Check for missing data!

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Step 2: Basic Analyses (SPSS)

Descriptive statistics: Analyze > Descriptive Statistics
Correlations: Analyze > Correlate > Bivariate
T-tests & ANOVAs: Analyze > Compare Means
Regression: Analyze > Regression > Linear

üìù Tip: Use ‚ÄúPaste‚Äù to see syntax!

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Example: SPSS Output

Describe what‚Äôs shown in a screenshot:

Table with means
Significance values
APA-style report


üì∏ (Add image with {.stretch} or similar if using Reveal.js)

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Bonus: Jamovi & R
Jamovi - Based on R, but with a GUI - Great for fast and clean outputs
R - RStudio + tidyverse for flexible analysis - Requires coding, but great for reproducibility
‚û°Ô∏è See our R Guide

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Reporting Your Results

Follow APA guidelines
Report:

Test type
Test statistic (e.g., t, F, r)
p-values and effect sizes
Graphs when useful


‚úÖ Example: > ‚ÄúA significant correlation was found between X and Y, r = .45, p < .01.‚Äù

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Resources & Support

SPSS video tutorials
Jamovi.org documentation
Ask your instructor or TA

üß† Practice = confidence!

title: FMII-SS25 Data analysis introduction
text:
Let‚Äôs Practice!

Open SPSS and import example_data.csv
Identify variable types
Run a descriptive analysis
Try a correlation or t-test

üí¨ Ask questions as we go!




all resources for you
